Articles.Content: I want to install a mod (tweakScale) but i can't find the ksp folder. it is not in the steamapps folder because i downloaded ksp from epic games. Can somebody help me?

Do you have an Shorcut on your desktop where you launch the game?

Right Click on it, it must show you the "target" of the Shortcut.
I do have the shortcut, but when i right click on it it does not show the target.

Bleh, I didn't gave you the full instructions. Sorry.

You need to select "Properties", and then the tab "Shortcut". Take a look on this full tutorial for reference:

https://www.addictivetips.com/windows-tips/find-original-file-shortcut/

I think I have Epic installed on some computer around here, I will give this a peek later after day job.

11 hours ago, StarDroid_5000 said:

I do have the shortcut, but when i right click on it it does not show the target.

Oukey. found the Windows 10 notebook and installed Epic on the thing.

You will find your KSP installation under Epic on:

C:\Program Files\Epic Games\KerbalSpaceProgram\English

However… It's really not the best of the ideas to mod the default installation directory from a Store (being it GOG, Steam or Epic), because these installers know squat about modding and they may remove or tamper them, screwing your savegames.

The best option is to Copy & Paste this directory into some other place (like the Desktop or perhaps a personal games folder in your $HOME, and then placing a Shortcut on the desktop to there) and then modding that personal copy. KSP doesn't have any kind of DRM, so you will not have any problems on doing that.

Cheers!

Edited June 27, 2023 by Lisias
Forgot the "\English
I found it, thanks so much for the help.
